item.title: Half-Link
item.description: The umbrella Race for all animal-humanoid races. Every Half-Link lineage has a distinct and rich culture and history, but every possible iteration is not represented. This version represents the most common, culturally fragmented sets of lineages not otherwise represented.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Dwarf
item.description: The most relatable Race.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Race
item.description:
Races are a classification similar to creature type, mainly tailored towards players. They are the various sapient species and beings that inhabit the setting. When creating a character, players typically choose a race to determine their character's physical appearance, unique abilities, cultural background, and narrative possibilities.
Most races have a racial language, but also know common. All creatures are assumed to have a base speed of 30ft, know Common, and be Medium in Size unless otherwise stated.
The lore used to describe races is to differentiate a given race from the others. It also gives people a starting point if they don't know how to roleplay or world build with a specific race.
The descriptions you find here (or in any source really) are tailored to a specific setting, or are the brain child of some other fantasy obsessed weirdo. They do not need to match how a specific race exists in your world if you have something else in mind.
Race page format:
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Acrobatics
item.description:
DEX-based Skill.
Used for Balance, Tumble, and Wall Kick.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Balance
item.description: Acrobatics can be used to cross slippery surfaces, such as ice or oil slicks, at full speed. Failing the check gives you the Knocked Down condition. It can also be used to traverse or stand on incredibly small and unstable spaces, such as a cliff side or a fallen tree branch.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tumble
item.description: If Trained in Acrobatics, you can avoid AoOs from moving through Threatened spaces. Acrobatics is rolled against all threatening creatures’ Reflex saves. The DC of their reflex save is equal to your Acrobatics Roll. If they succeed, your movement Provokes as normal.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Wall Kick
item.description: If Trained in Acrobatics, As long as there are 2 walls within 5 feet of each other, or a similar arrangement with some horizontal layout, you can continually hop between them to ascend or travel. Only the vertical OR horizontal distance you cover counts against your Movement, not both. This still takes a Jump action.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Aquatic Combat
item.description: Fighting underwater gives a -4 Circumstance penalty to AC, Reflex, and ACC. Being Trained in Athletics or possessing a Swim Speed removes the penalty.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Athletics
item.description:
STR-based Skill, or DEX when appropriate.
Used for Climb, Swim, Brute Force, Catch Fall, and Aquatic Combat.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Brute Force
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can use Brute Force when there are no lockpicks or beasts of burden to handle your problems. The DC to break apart an object is modified by its quality, materials, and size. Substantial failure may cause back problems.
You can also use Athletics to represent bursts of strength that allow you to surpass your normal Carry Weight to shift large objects.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Catch Fall
item.description: When Proficient in Athletics, as an Immediate Action, you can attempt to grab onto something to stop your fall, or to prevent an ally within reach from falling. The DC to do this is 20+the height fallen before the catch. You do not take Fall Damage when successful.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Climb
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can climb surfaces. Spaces you climb through are considered difficult terrain. With Athletics Proficiency, you climb at full Speed.
If you have a Climb Speed, you get a +8 bonus and use that speed instead.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Swim
item.description:
Using Athletics, you can swim through liquids. Spaces you swim through are considered difficult terrain. With Athletics Proficiency, you swim at full Speed.
If you have a Swim Speed, you get a +8 bonus and use that speed instead.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Create a Distraction
item.description: Using Deception as a Standard Action, you can shout something at your enemies to briefly get them to look the other way so you can give them the slip. All creatures get a roll to try and beat yours. If you succeed, you are able to roll Stealth, and they won't know where you went. This does not prevent people from finding you again using Perception.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Deception
item.description:
CHA-based Skill, normally rolled against Insight.
Used to Lie, Disguise, Feint, Create a Distraction, Subtle Message, and Sucker Punch.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disguise
item.description:
Using Trained Deception, spend 10 minutes perfecting your makeup, outfit, and wig to appear as a person or playable race you're not. Disguise checks are usually unnecessary unless you fall under scrutiny, the person knows you/what you're pretending to be, or you're trying to enter an exclusive club, in which case they get a Perception check. Creatures get bonuses to their Perception if they know you or what you're disguised as particularly well.
You take a -2 penalty to Disguise when you try to change your race and when you change your apparent gender. When you initiate a Disguise, you tell your DM your bonus, they apply any appropriate Circumstance modifiers and roll it in secret.
Crafting a disguise without a disguise kit or magic imposes a -5 penalty.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Lie
item.description:
Use Deception against a target's Insight to speak falsehoods, or to soften the truth. See Detect Dishonesty. It may be more entertaining if the DM rolls this in secret to preserve tension.
Common modifiers to increase the DC include:

The target has firsthand experience with the events
Claims that are fantastical or impossible, such as equating angels with demons or asserting a green sky
The target is knowledgeable of the subject matter
Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include:

The target is inattentive, such as from being tired or drunk
The target trusts you
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Subtle Message
item.description: By speaking in roundabout terms and making subtle gestures, you can use Trained Deception to communicate a simple idea (such as "we need to leave", or "time to strike") while not talking about it directly, to avoid alerting others of your intentions. The DC to convey this message is 20. The intended recipient automatically understands the message. Anyone that may be suspicious gets an Insight check to beat your Deception.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Sucker Punch
item.description:
If you are in some kind of standoff where you aren't quite fighting your enemy yet, you can use Trained Deception or Trained Hands as a replacement for Stealth to Surprise your enemy with a melee Attack. The enemy must be aware of you in order to Sucker Punch, otherwise it is Stealth, and you must already be adjacent to use Hands for it. If you don't use an Unarmed Strike, then you have disadvantage on this check, unless you use Hands.
Certain situations where you are not able to get close to your aggressors, such as having bows pointed at you from a garrison above you, make Sucker Punching impossible.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Conceal Item
item.description:
Use Hands to conceal an item on your person. Should someone search you or otherwise have access to you to find such an item (such as if your clothes was lifted), you must roll Hands against their Perception to prevent them from discovering the item. Concealed items cannot be procured as a Free Action or Instant Action.
You can use Trained Hands as a Swift Action to draw a concealed weapon. If you win the opposed check, the target is Surprised against your next attack. You can use this as an alternative to Stealth to Surprise an enemy when you are otherwise in a neutral position, and the opposing party is aware of you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Disable Device
item.description:
Use Hands to disable a trap or similar mechanism, magical or mundane, as long as it is armed and you have detected its presence. Failure triggers the trap.
If you are Proficient in Hands, you can disable it temporarily or otherwise slightly modify the trap to better suit your needs.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hands
item.description:
DEX-based Skill.
Used for Pickpocket, Conceal Item, Pick Lock, and Disable Device.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pick Lock
item.description:
Use Hands to open a lock without a key.
This takes 1 or 5 rounds, depending on the DC of the lock - DC 30 and up is 5 rounds.
Attempting this without a Thief Tools gives a -5 penalty.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Pickpocket
item.description:
As a Standard Action, use Trained Hands on a distracted or Surprised creature to pilfer an object off of their person. This is opposed to the Perception of the target and any nearby creatures that can witness you. Failure indicates that the target noticed an unwanted intrusion on their person, and the theft fails.
Items that are closely bound to the target cause a -5 penalty to Pickpocket.
Items that are worn or held in the hands cannot be pickpocketed.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Compulsion
item.description: Use Trained Insight to determine when a creature is under duress from a spell or some other kind of effect that has a lasting impact on their mind, such as when Dominated or Possessed. You must actively search for this by speaking with the creature for 1 minute. Roll Insight vs the DC of the effect. If the effect has no DC, assume a basic DC based on the Potency of the source.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Dishonesty
item.description:
Whenever a creature makes a statement, you can roll Insight (opposed by Deception) to see if what they say aligns with what they think. If you roll lower, or if they aren't being dishonest, you don't detect dishonesty. If you succeed, you determine that something is fishy - or if a statement lacks nuance (such as a yes or no response), you can determine the correct answer. Prying further about the deception may cause the creature to reveal the truth or become hostile depending on context.
This can be combined with Deception against their Insight to hide whether or not they know you know they're being dishonest. When this is done, it may be more entertaining to have the DM roll in secret, and distribute results in secret, in order to preserve tension.
You can only roll Insight on a particular assertion or topic once.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Insight
item.description:
WIS-based Skill, but CHA can be used if it's a social cue.
Used for Detect Dishonesty, Detect Compulsion, and Intuition.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Intuition
item.description:
By using Trained Insight, you can observe a structure or item whose function is known, an event unfolding, or a behavior pattern to try and glean information about it. The DC is modified by how much knowledge you already possess on the topic, or how closely you're able to investigate it. A success gives you nearly prescient knowledge about the intention behind the structure, item, event, or behavioral pattern that goes beyond a basic understanding of function.
For example, when used on a Trap whose function is to shoot an arrow, your character may determine that based on its unusual angle and obvious placement, it may have been used to deter adventures from finding a secret in its line of sight instead of to actually effectively trap them. The knowledge you glean from this success will always be the reality of the situation when you follow your intuition.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Coercion
item.description:
With Trained Intimidation, by having a conversation with a creature that lasts at least one minute, or by defeating a creature in combat, you can shape how they respond to you or anybody asking about you in the future. The strength of this creature's conviction is dependent on your Intimidation Roll against it.
You can make the creature keep their mouth shut about something you did to them. Any checks to gather information from this creature about you or your party change to your roll if it would be higher than the usual DC.
You can greatly exaggerate what you did to further spread fear and grand tales of your strength. Any Knowledge checks that creatures make on you when hearing about information that spreads from this creature changes to your Intimidation roll if it would be higher than the usual DC, or else they learn false information.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Demoralize
item.description:
As an Action-Attack, inflict Shaken 1 on an enemy that can see or hear you within 30 feet. Roll Intimidation versus their Will. They are Shaken as long as you are nearby, and for 1 minute after. You can Demoralize a creature repeatedly to increase the penalty. If they pass their save, their shaken value from Demoralize decreases by 1.
If you are Trained, you can inflict Frightened instead on creatures you have Defeated before. This lasts one round, and can only be done once per day per creature. This doesn't work if they Defeated you once before as well.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Intimidation
item.description:
CHA-based Skill, or optionally STR when using displays of might.
Used for Coercion and Demoralize.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Alchemy
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Oozes.
Used for Identify Potion, Identify Composition, and Craft alchemical items.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Composition
item.description: Use Alchemy on an unknown substance to learn how to create it, if it has or can be created through Alchemy. The DC is the Craft DC+5.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Potion
item.description: Use Alchemy to identify a held Potion or Poison with a sniff or taste. The DC is the item's Craft DC.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Arcana
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Monsters.
Used for Identify Spell and Identify Magic Item.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Magic Item
item.description:
Use [Arcana] to identify all of the magic properties of a Magic Item in reach as an Action. The DC is the item's Potency, +10 if it's cursed.
This can be attempted once per day per item.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Spell
item.description:
By observing a Spell as it is being cast, you can Instantly use Arcana to identify which Spell it is. The DC is 5 per level of the Technique (not including Upcast.)
This is useful for determining whether you want to take action in response, or it has no immediate effect - though many Spells do not need to be identified if you already know the spell.
You may use Astronomy to identify Lunar spells, and Nature to identify Gaia spells.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Astronomy
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Abominations.
Used for Navigation, Identify Spell, and Identify Cosmic Phenomenon.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Cosmic Phenomenon
item.description:
Using Astronomy with aid of devices such as telescopes (if necessary), you can determine the cause of cosmic phenomenon, or you can predict them in advance. This can be something like a solar eclipse, a comet, or something more drastic like a meteor or supernova.
You can also tell if something unusual is happening, such as someone using illusions to improperly represent the night sky, or cast spells that produce effects similar to cosmic phenomenon.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Navigation
item.description: With a clear view of the night time sky, you can determine where you are and where you need to be. You can use Astronomy as an alternative to Survival for navigation in such circumstances. This skill replaces Survival during space travel.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Engineering
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Constructs.
Used for Identify Function, Hack, and Identify Structural Quirk.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hack
item.description: Using Engineering, where there exists technology, there exists a method to disable or gain control of it, even if only temporarily. Hacking always requires a hands-on approach.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Function
item.description: Use Engineering to identify the purpose of particularly complex machinery. Depending on the size and scope of what you're looking at, this could only be a glance, or it could require a few minutes, and usually requires a hands-on approach.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Structural Quirk
item.description: Large scale buildings such as castles, watchtowers, walls, factories, prisons etc. Are all built with specific purposes, facilities and defenses in mind. You can use Engineering to figure out aspects of these buildings, such as where exhaust/waste pipes lead, how far underground you might need to go to go underneath the structure, and even structural weaknesses.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Humanities
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Humanoids and Titans.
Used for Recall Customs, Recognize Figure, and Recall Locale.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recall Customs
item.description: Using Humanities, you can recall information about how to conduct yourself with foreign cultures. This can be particularly useful when trying to gain someone's favor, such as royalty. You can also recall information about holidays, festivals and ceremonies.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recall Locale
item.description: Using Humanities, you can recall the answer to a specific simple question such as "where can I buy potions?" or "where does the royalty live?" or "where can I hire someone to build something?" These questions can be applied to the town you're in or with a higher DC, something much bigger like a country or continent.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Recognize Figure
item.description: Using Humanities, you can attach a name to a face, or vice versa. You generally understand aspects of a creature's reputation, their affiliations, and their general capabilities. Exceptionally high rolls might even land you some secrets or gossip related to this creature.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Natural Phenomenon
item.description:
Use Nature to identify natural processes like photosynthesis, the reproduction of creatures, and tectonic activity. You can do things like figuring out if a volcano is about to erupt, what could be causing plants to die, or how long until an egg hatches.
You can also identify natural fauna, flora, and minerals, and their potential uses.
When used to predict weather, you need to roll well to accurately predict more than a day ahead. You can also tell whether the weather is natural, or if it's being caused by magic.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Nature
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Plants, Fey, and Beasts.
Used for Identify Natural Phenomenon and Identify Spell.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Portal
item.description:
Using Planes, you can detect, identify, and disable portals.
Portals are strange phenomenon, but there are signs that they exist miles away from where the portal is actually located. If a portal is naturally occurring, you can use a DC 30 check to find its general area, or where it appears if it is not currently open. If it's manufactured, you can use a DC 20 check, or the caster's opposed Arcana, whichever is higher.
In the presence of a portal, you can tell where its destination plane is. Rolling higher can give more specific locations, more details about the portals creation and how often it gets used. This starts at DC 10.
Disabling a portal is a task that is very difficult by one's self. Failure could mean getting stuck on the wrong side of the portal, or hyper-charging the portal to attract extraplanar creatures. Using Planes is usually a short-term and rushed method. The DC starts at 30.
Using a Ritual with Invocation and Arcana can make the process of disabling a portal more safe.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Planes
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Fiends, Celestials, and Elementals.
Used for Detect Portal.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Divine Lore
item.description: Using Religion, you can identify a symbol (DC 10) tied to a person, object, or locale to determine its religious affiliation, as well as the tenets (DC 15) of a given religion and its chosen (DC 20) artifacts, people, and events of significance. You can also determine how to gain favor from a particular god (DC 15).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Religion
item.description:
INT-based Trained Knowledge Skill.
Allows the use of Monster Lore on Undead.
Used for Divine Lore.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: History
item.description:
All Knowledge Skills can be used to glean relevant History for their subject matters.
The includes recalling major events, figures, artifacts, and deciphering hieroglyphs.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Knowledge
item.description:
INT-based Skill. You cannot roll Knowledge if you are not Trained.
Knowledge is broken up into many different skills based on subject, and each one has a subsection dedicated to Monster Lore of specific types of creatures. Monster Lore isn’t its own skill, it is instead an action that uses the individual Knowledge skills. If a subject or creature falls into multiple categories, then players can choose whichever they like more, but an individual character can't roll multiple checks with different skills - instead, they receive a +2 bonus for each overlapping Knowledge they possess.
If you want to know who an individual creature is and their relevance to the world, rather than their stats and abilities, the DC is usually dependent on how popular they are. This is typically 30-LV with additional reductions to the DC if they are famous or in a position of power, or increases in the DC if they work to keep their identity and exploits hidden.
All Knowledge Skills can be used to recall the History of the associated subject as well, such as using Humanities to learn about ancient Elf-Human relations that shaped the current world.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Monster Lore
item.description:
Adventurers are assumed to know basic things about monsters, like how a Construct's lack of anatomy grants them resistance to many effects, or the properties of Incorporeal creatures. Monster Lore checks are for figuring out more information about specific monster types, or if a creature is hiding its typing.
Monster stat blocks are broken up into sections. Basic stats (Saves, HP and AC), offense traits (breath weapons, dangerous auras, prominent spells), defense traits (healing abilities, elemental Resistances), other traits (extra senses, extra movement options, out of combat abilities) and weaknesses/deep lore (lich's phylactery, vampires not appearing in mirrors).
Rolling a Monster Lore check is something you can do as a Free Action once per turn. It is assumed that you also vocalize what you learn to your team. The base DC of a Monster Lore check is (10+creature's LV). By succeeding on a Monster Lore check, you can figure out a creature's basic stats and one other category for your choice. For every 5 over the DC you roll, you figure out another category. If a creature has nothing in a category, you choose another.
Creatures with the [unique] tag in their entry increase their Monster Lore DC by 5. Humanoids with class levels by default are assumed to have the [unique] tag, unless their class comes with clearly distinguishable features (such as a Dark Knight's Evil Eye), or they are part of an organization with similar training and abilities (such as a Monk dojo or city guards).
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Encode or Decode Documents
item.description: Using Linguistics, you can write things in ways that are difficult to interpret without a cipher, such as disguising your forbidden ritual as a cookbook. The DC to your code is 10+(Linguistics bonus). Creatures that know the code can read encoded text, but creatures that don't will interpret the text as something else. To read encoded text, you must first crack the code, usually requiring at least a week of research. At the end of the week, roll a Linguistics check versus the writer’s DC to crack the code.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Interpret Text
item.description: Using Linguistics, you peruse a book, contract, or other written work to quickly summarize what it says in one minute. The DC for most works is 10, but it changes based on the size and complexity of the work at hand. Failure indicates more time is necessary to understand what the text contains. Finding oddities in a contract requires an opposed Linguistics check.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Language
item.description: Most creatures that can speak will know Common. Some isolated or xenophobic creatures may only speak their native tongue.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Linguistics
item.description:
INT-based Skill.
Proficiency in Linguistics grants an additional known Core Rules, How to Play/Tags/Language per level.
Used for Interpret Text, Write or Forge Documents, and Encode or Decode Documents.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Assess Vitality
item.description: Using Medicine, you can examine a creature that is wounded to determine how they were injured, how long ago it happened, and whether they are in grave danger of dying. This also functions on corpses for cause of death. The more complex the ailment and the longer the duration since it happened, the higher the DC. Difficulty based on duration may reverse in scaling in the case of diseases, where more time passing makes the symptoms more obvious.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Identify Affliction or Curse
item.description:
Use Trained Medicine to examine a creature for one minute. You can identify whether they have an Affliction or Curse, the effects of such, and how to cure them.
The DC is 5 times the Affliction level, or the DC of the Curse.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Long Term Care
item.description: Use Trained Medicine to assist yourself or another creature such that they can recover a stack of Drained every 3 days instead of 7. This care is required for some Afflictions.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Medicine
item.description:
WIS-based Skill.
Used for Assess Vitality, Provide First Aid, Long Term Care, Prevent Recovery, and Identify Affliction or Curse.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Prevent Recovery
item.description: Use Trained Medicine for one minute to prevent a Defeated creature from being able to recover on their own. This lasts 24 hours.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Provide First Aid
item.description: Use Trained Medicine as a Standard Action to cure a creature in reach of Status ailments. You can remove Sickened stacks, Bleeding, and Blurred Vision. The DC of removing any of these conditions is the DC of the ability that inflicted them.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Detect Hidden Presence
item.description:
As a Standard Action, you become more observant of your surroundings, gaining an additional Perception check to detect traps, creatures, or details that are hidden from view.
When a creature is not doing anything with its Standard Action and is moving at a normal pace, it is assumed to be using Detect Hidden Presence every round.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Perception
item.description:
WIS-based Skill. All creatures are Proficient in Perception, unless they are Mindless or specify otherwise.
Used for Detect Hidden Presence. Used as a defense against skills like Hands and Stealth.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Perform
item.description:
CHA-based Skill.
Proficiency in Perform only applies to specific instruments or Performance types. The bonus for having this skill only applies to the chosen types.
Examples of Performances include instruments like flutes, pianos, or drums, physical displays such as singing and dancing, and displays of charm such as comedy.
Used for Performance and Economy.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Performance
item.description:
Attempt to put on a show for other creatures using Perform. Whether it's music, action, or stand-up, benefits will be extended to entertaining individuals.
Performances are an important part of every culture. They are a commonly desired luxury, and some Afflictions require Performance as a cure.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Coax
item.description:
When an NPC is on the fence or indifferent about a request, and the requester doesn't have anything left to say to sway them, Persuasion can be used to get the target to agree or counter-offer.
The DC varies based on how effective the conversation was before rolling. Requests that align with the target's interests, offerings that make them happy, and moral arguments that resonate with their values will lower the DC, while the opposite will increase it.
Passing the check results in the NPC requesting something in return, while rolling significantly higher may cause them to waive any additional requests, or even offer additional assistance that wasn't requested.
This action can also be used when the NPC already agreed due to good conversation in-character, in order to try to sweeten the deal if the requester rolls exceptionally well.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Example DCs
item.description:
Common modifiers to make the task more difficult can include racism, your questions/requests being offensive or closely guarded secrets by the target, and not being well-liked by the person/people you are persuading.
Common modifiers to make the task less difficult can include being well-liked by the person/people you are persuading, holding a position of authority over them, or it would benefit the person you're speaking to to reveal the information you're looking for.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Persuasion
item.description:
CHA-based Skill.
Used for Coax and Gather Information.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Profession
item.description:
WIS or INT-based Skill. For crafting, INT is used, and Trained individuals can use any ability score for Economy uses if doing so has a justification in-character.
Professions can be anything used to provide a service or create a product. When you gain a profession, you choose one such specialization, such as Profession (Baker).
Used for Economics and Quiz.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Quiz
item.description: Use Profession to answer basic questions about a type of craft or service job. Most simple facts are DC 10, but anything higher is Trained-only. Proficient creatures automatically know most simple facts about their Profession.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hide
item.description:
As a Swift Action, Use Stealth to prevent enemies from knowing your exact location. This lasts until you are spotted.
Whenever an enemy has line of sight to you, or you cause some other detectable stimuli, they roll Perception against your Stealth. If you Attack a creature, it gets a +20 bonus on its check. A Ranged Attack grants a +10 bonus.
While moving at half speed or slower and not having taken an action, you get an additional Roll to avoid detection.
You can only take this action while you have Cover or Concealment.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Hide Trail
item.description: Use Trained Stealth to hide your trail, turning attempts to Track you into an opposed check of their Survival vs your Stealth -5.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Stealth
item.description:
DEX-based Skill.
Used for Hide and Hide Trail.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Butcher
item.description:
Spend a minute to use Survival to skin, drain, dress, and otherwise harvest the organic components from a recently killed creature.
Obtaining organic loot from creatures is an important part of the game. Creatures that have listed drops when butchered will always give these items without a check if there is not a listed DC.
Any organic materials that reasonably spoil will do so if not used in a timely manner (varies based off the part, but no less than 3 days).
Using Survival to get additional resources beyond what is listed in a creature's entry grants materials worth an amount equal to the creature's LV^2 times 10. This has a DC of 10+creature's LV. At the DM's discretion, the harvest can be worth more or less or made easier or harder depending on the rarity of the creature and demand for its products.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Live off Land
item.description:
Creatures Proficient in Survival can spend an hour in a wilderness area with suitable sources of food and water to create a Field Ration.
In areas that are unsuitable for life, such as deserts, a skill check is needed to succeed at this action. Failure indicates that the time is wasted.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Navigate
item.description: When moving through unfamiliar territory, Survival can be used to get a sense of direction and move towards an intended destination. Higher rolls include avoiding unwanted encounters, while lower rolls represent less progress made towards the destination, or reaching the incorrect destination.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Survival
item.description:
WIS-based Skill.
Used for Navigate, Butcher, Live off Land, and Track.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Track
item.description: Use Survival to follow the path another creature took by looking for footprints, disturbed leaves, markings, etc. The older the tracks, the higher the DC to track them. With ideal conditions, you can follow trails made days or weeks ago.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Group Checks
item.description: When working cooperatively, such as to Craft an item or work a machine, use the group's highest bonus, plus 1 per helper, or 2 if they're also Proficient (max +10). When the weakest link can sink a team's effort, such as with Stealth, use the group's lowest bonus, plus the help.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Proficiency
item.description: Proficiency in a Skill marks you as "Trained" rather than "Untrained." Proficiency grants more uses for some skills.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Skill
item.description:
Skill Rolls are how players interact with the world without hitting it with their sword. Even if certain actions have a skill associated with them, you don't necessarily need to roll a skill check (no need to roll Deception if they already believe you, no need to roll Athletics in still water, etc.) When one is required, it is prompted by the DM.
If the DC to a task is more than 30 points higher than the bonus on the roll, then the DM should deem it impossible in cases where "fishing" for a success with no repercussions is the intent. The special roll allows rolling any number, so if a task is well out of a character's reach such that the DC difference is that high, it may be better to not allow the roll to preserve the narrative.
This roll can be very swingy, creating dramatically unexpected results. As such, using a skill roll as a barrier for entry can create all or nothing scenarios. There's nothing wrong with saying "the lock is too complex for you to pick," but you can't be upset when immediately after the martials of the party start smashing into the door. There should be lesser versions of success. If you barely fail the DC to scale a wall, it lowers your speed instead of falling. If you barely fail a Stealth check while trailing someone, they can tell someone is in the bushes, but not who.
Many things should not be represented by a skill or ability roll. For example, do not roll to see if someone can lift a portcullis - This is already represented by their Carrying Capacity. You should also carefully consider what a roll represents, and whether rerolls are appropriate. When rolls are made, don't be surprised when the party's expert sometimes gets outdone by the party's pet chicken. A skill check should be summarized with a "you can or you can't" when rolling may cause inconsistencies.
Skill bonuses are increased by one relevant Ability Score modifier. You add 2x the bonus to your skill check if you are Proficient.
Proficiency in a skill grants you a 2+LV bonus to the skill. Certain aspects of a skill might only be available to characters that are proficient in the skill.
Standard skill DCs are what should be used in the absence of a set or opposed DC. Remember that every 10 point difference makes the task twice as hard. They are as follows…

Some skills are opposed to other skills, while other skills will include examples comparable this chart.

item.title: Take 10
item.description: You can take 10 on non-opposed skill checks. This means instead of rolling, you automatically get a Natural 10. This is suitable for crafting or skipping tasks that aren't too difficult for you.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Take 30
item.description: When not under duress, you can spend ten times the time the task normally takes to achieve your best effort, automatically getting a Natural 30. It is assumed you trigger the failure result ten times, making this unsuitable for crafting or disarming traps.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Tie
item.description: When making an opposed Skill check, ties are rerolled.

item.title: Spell Components
item.description:
These rules do not apply to innate casting.

All spells have a Staff component. Disarming a mage of their staff prevents them from casting using it, and ends any spell they're concentrating on with it.
"Staff" components do not need to be exclusively provided by staves. Many other items, such as wands and seals, can also be used to serve the Staff component.

Staff - Staves are usually long and sturdy pieces of wood. Most of the magical components of the staff are attached to the end of it. Staves can universally be used as weapons, and may augment specific kinds of spells.
Seal - Seals have an enormous amount of variety to them. They are typically compact: Some small handheld object, often of spiritual significance. Seals are ineffective unless they are the only thing occupying the hand. Seals often alter the use of spells.
Wand - Wands are usually small pieces of wood about in the rough shape of a pencil, but usually a bit larger. Wands are lightweight and easy to bring many of, and may grant additional spells prepared.
Tome - Tomes, grimoires, or otherwise magical books can often serve as Staff components. They can be used to prepare spells you do not know, and must be in hand when used to cast said spells.

Any spell with a Material component has an item with a price associated with that is consumed on use. Anything with a Focus component has an item with a price associated that is NOT consumed on use.
You do not need to have these items in your hand - they merely need to be on your person to be used. They may briefly appear in the visuals of the spell or otherwise float out of your inventory as necessary.

All spells have a verbal component. Verbal components cannot be whispered, and you must speak them clearly. Anything that prevents the mage from speaking prevents them from casting, such as being silenced.
The verbal components often contain a plain-language reading of the spell's structure or its name, in a Language known by the caster. When observing a caster using a language you understand, you need only have Arcana to identify it.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Spells
item.description:
Spellcasting is a general title that applies to a specific type of magical effect, with specific rules. Spells do not encompass all magic, but it is the most common type. Most Spells are Techniques.
All spells have some kind of visual effect associated with their casting before the effect occurs. Magic circles shining fingers and eyes, words manifesting into physical objects and circling the caster are all means to easily identify when a creature is casting a spell. The only exception to this is spells with the Subtle tag.
This is also the case for Innate Casting.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Innate Techniques
item.description:
Some Techniques can be granted outside of the standard progression, such as when gained from Race, Class, magic item, specialized training, or a boon granted by another creature. Not all Techniques gained in this way are innate - these are much more common on monsters.
Innate Techniques do not take up Mana slots and are always prepared.
Innate Techniques grant creatures the ability to use Techniques without the usual requirements. Spells do not require the Staff component that other casting typically requires. If a spell has a material or focus component, that is also ignored with innate casting.
Unless otherwise specified, you cannot re-prepare limited innate techniques to regain their use.
If a creature's innate constant spell is deactivated, it can reactivate it as a Swift Action.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Preparing Techniques
item.description:
When you have technique points invested in a specific style, you can prepare any of the techniques of the tier you have unlocked. Mana slots determine how many techniques you can have prepared or "memorized" at any given time and thus what you can use at a given moment.
All techniques are assumed to take 1 mana slot unless stated otherwise.
Abilities from items, classes, etc. do not take mana slots unless stated otherwise - see Innate Techniques.
item.dc:creator: Malon Elenia

item.title: Technique
item.description:
A Technique is the form most abilities take. They are one of the major means of combat progression in the game.
Techniques are often things that you use in combat, but many have out-of-combat uses as well. Spells may contain a greater portion of out-of-combat effects.
Techniques are either martial or magic, in the form of Spells. By default, non-Spell Techniques are Martial.
In general, classes get access to a few technique trees. They gain technique points at odd levels, or may automatically get a specific tree at those odd levels. Techniques are separated into five levels, requiring 6 points of investment in order to reach the highest tier.
Every even level, you get a technique point you can invest into any technique path, separate from what you get from your class. For every point you invest, you get access to a new level of technique.
Technique levels have a hard character LV requirement when investing points to unlock more. At level 1, you can unlock the first tier, but every tier thereafter is available at every odd level, maxing out at tier 6 at level 11.

item.title: 🍔 Mission Statement
item.description:
Malon's Marvelous Misadventures is a TTRPG where the players take on the roles of capable adventurers in a fantasy world, facing off against the odds themselves as they plow through hordes and chow down on the rewards! It's centered on systems that maximize the ease of content creation and compatibility with what exists in other tactical TTRPGs.
The content provided will be enough to run relatively lighthearted fantasy games, and serves as a basis to create more and adapt it to your needs. The game mechanics are a blend of real-world intuition and game-y themes, setting a stage with a healthy amount of suspension of disbelief to allow more creative solutions to problems without worrying too much about adherence to realism.
